meanings.sent1: She had a muckle of toys in her room.
meanings.sent2: The farmer harvested a muckle of corn this season.
meanings.sent3: Carrying that muckle of books made her arms ache.
meanings.sent4: The muckle of stars in the night sky was breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: The muckle of balloons filled the room with color.

meanings.definition: To gather or collect in large amounts
meanings.sent1: They muckle berries from the bushes in the forest.
meanings.sent2: Let's muckle all the leaves into a pile for jumping.
meanings.sent3: He tried to muckle all the scattered puzzle pieces quickly.
meanings.sent4: The children muckled seashells along the shore.
meanings.sent5: She muckled up all the courage she had to speak in front of the class.

meanings.definition: To handle or deal with something in a clumsy or awkward manner
meanings.sent1: He always muckles the delicate china dishes.
meanings.sent2: She tends to muckle up the paperwork when she's in a rush.
meanings.sent3: Trying to muckle the heavy box, he almost dropped it.
meanings.sent4: The chef muckled the cake frosting, creating a messy design.
meanings.sent5: She muckled the dance steps but managed to laugh it off.
